about.summary: New tools for the visualization of missing and/or imputed values are introduced, which can be used for exploring the data and the structure of the missing and/or imputed values. Depending on this structure of the missing values, the corresponding methods may help to identify the mechanism generating the missing values and allows to explore the data including missing values. In addition, the quality of imputation can be visually explored using various univariate, bivariate, multiple and multivariate plot methods (<doi:10.1007/s11634-011-0102-y>). A graphical user interface available in the separate package VIMGUI allows an easy handling of the implemented plot methods. Fast imputation methods such as k-nearest neighbor imputation (<doi:10.18637/jss.v074.i07>) and imputation using robust methods are provided (<doi:10.1016/j.csda.2011.04.012>).

name: r-vim

about.summary: New tools for the visualization of missing and/or imputed values are introduced, which can be used for exploring the data and the structure of the missing and/or imputed values. Depending on this structure of the missing values, the corresponding methods may help to identify the mechanism generating the missing values and allows to explore the data including missing values. In addition, the quality of imputation can be visually explored using various univariate, bivariate, multiple and multivariate plot methods (<doi:10.1007/s11634-011-0102-y>). A graphical user interface available in the separate package VIMGUI allows an easy handling of the implemented plot methods. Fast imputation methods such as k-nearest neighbor imputation (<doi:10.18637/jss.v074.i07>) and imputation using robust methods are provided (<doi:10.1016/j.csda.2011.04.012>).

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "6.2.2" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-vim
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/VIM_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/VIM/VIM_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: afa7492c54508c46eff39ac66fa4b05627e0044253ebe4a61b2a78d459f715e4

build:
  number: 4
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-mass                       # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-rcpp                       # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-car                        # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-colorspace                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-data.table                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-e1071                      # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-laeken                     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-magrittr                   # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-nnet                       # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-ranger                     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-robustbase                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-sp                         # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-vcd                        # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}          # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}            # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}    # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}      # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}  # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-rcpp
    - r-car
    - r-colorspace
    - r-data.table >=1.9.4
    - r-e1071
    - r-laeken
    - r-magrittr
    - r-nnet
    - r-ranger
    - r-robustbase
    - r-sp
    - r-vcd
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-rcpp
    - r-car
    - r-colorspace
    - r-data.table >=1.9.4
    - r-e1071
    - r-laeken
    - r-magrittr
    - r-nnet
    - r-ranger
    - r-robustbase
    - r-sp
    - r-vcd

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('VIM')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('VIM')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/statistikat/VIM
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: New tools for the visualization of missing and/or imputed values are introduced, which can be used for exploring the data and the structure of the missing and/or imputed values. Depending on this structure of the missing values, the corresponding methods may help to identify the mechanism generating the missing
    values and allows to explore the data including missing values. In addition, the quality of imputation can be visually explored using various univariate, bivariate, multiple and multivariate plot methods (<doi:10.1007/s11634-011-0102-y>). A graphical user interface available in the separate package VIMGUI allows an easy
    handling of the implemented plot methods. Fast imputation methods such as k-nearest neighbor imputation (<doi:10.18637/jss.v074.i07>) and imputation using robust methods are provided (<doi:10.1016/j.csda.2011.04.012>).
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - MathiasHaudgaard
    - FrodePedersen
    - ArneKr

In addition, the quality of imputation can be visually explored using various univariate, bivariate, multiple and multivariate plot methods (<doi:10.1007/s11634-011-0102-y>).
